message.content: Yes, the authors include complete proofs of all theoretical results. They provide detailed explanations, necessary definitions, and present theorems and proofs throughout the main text and appendix. Additionally, they propose an algorithm (Algorithm 1) and prove its efficiency and approximation factor through Theorem 3. Overall, the paper demonstrates a comprehensive explanation of their theoretical findings.

Yes, the authors include complete proofs of all theoretical results in the paper, including proofs for major theorems and lemmas. The paper also uses proof sketches for some results and refers to the appendix for full details. In particular, the complete proof of Theorem 2 is provided in the paper as a proof sketch, and Theorem 3 is presented along with a polynomial time algorithm implementing the corresponding mechanism. The appendix is not provided in the given text, but the paper mentions that they have included additional proof details in the appendix to support the case study and other results.

Yes, the authors include complete proofs of all theoretical results in the paper. They have provided formal definitions, lemmas, theorems, and algorithm steps, along with their proofs and explanation of the results. This allows for a comprehensive understanding of the theoretical foundations and the proposed mechanism.
